statement: Adults who will have hip or knee replacement are given advice on preoperative rehabilitation when they are listed for surgery.
Adults with isolated medial compartmental osteoarthritis who will have knee replacement are given the choice of partial or total replacement.
Adults having hip or knee replacement are given tranexamic acid during surgery.
Adults having hip, knee or shoulder replacement have 2 'stop moments' during surgery so that implant details and the compatibility of all components can be checked.
Adults who have had hip, knee or shoulder replacement are given advice on postoperative rehabilitation before discharge.
